title: Can anyone define Legal realism and its kinds? - Quora
tags: Legal Issues and Law in Everyday Life

response.answer_text: Description Legal realism is a naturalistic approach to law. It is the view that jurisprudence should emulate the methods of natural science, i.e., rely on empirical evidence. Hypotheses must be tested against observations of the world. Wikipedia FYI: not to be confused with legal fiction:)
